definition: to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request
fitting snugly/appropriate/suitable/variant of 貼|贴[tie1]/to paste/to obey

sentences.english: She managed to wangle an invitation to the reception.
sentences.chinese: 她設法弄到了招待會的請帖。

sentences.english: In this digital age, E-mail invitations, called "E-vites" are becoming popular.
sentences.chinese: 在這個數字時代，網上請帖日漸流行。

sentences.english: I sent them an invitation, but they didn't even bother to reply.
sentences.chinese: 我給他們寄了個請帖，但他們竟連話也懶得回。

sentences.english: I wangled an invitation out of George.
sentences.chinese: 我哄喬治給我發了請帖。

sentences.english: Since we sent out the invitations we've received seven acceptances and one refusal.
sentences.chinese: 我們發出請帖後，收到的回覆是七位接受，一位推辭。

sentences.english: All the wedding invitations have gone out.
sentences.chinese: 所有的結婚請帖都發出去了。

sentences.english: I received his invitation but Idid not accept it.
sentences.chinese: 我收到了他的請帖，但並沒有接受他的邀請。

sentences.english: Invitation to participate in the feast of fish, usually made of colored cardboard fish.
sentences.chinese: 參加魚宴的請帖，通常是用紙板做成的彩色小魚。

sentences.english: Mom took Helen wedding invitations asked small nan want to go to.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽拿着海倫的結婚請帖問小楠要不要去。

sentences.english: Participating in the color feast's invites a note , is the colour fingerling using cardboard to succeed in making up generally.
sentences.chinese: 參加色宴的請帖，通常是用紙板做成的彩色小魚。

sentences.english: Jokes are also frequently used," said the supplier of the mobile message. "It is also very convenient for receivers to reply with well wishes."
sentences.chinese: 收到手機請帖的人回覆祝賀短信也非常方便。

sentences.english: For openers , we need to design invitations for the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我們必須爲結婚設計請帖。

sentences.english: The invitation to participate in the fish dinner, usually made of colored cardboard fish.
sentences.chinese: 參加魚宴的請帖，通常是用紙板做成的彩色小魚。

sentences.english: I only mean this is the third time that I receive such invitation this month.
sentences.chinese: 我只是說這個月我已經收到3次請帖了。

definition: to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to do sth in place of sb else
indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
